p: The M protein (~ 25–30 kDa) with three transmembrane domains is the most abundant structural protein and defines the shape of the viral envelope[ 46, 47]. Interaction of S with M protein is necessary for retention of S in the ER-Golgi intermediate compartment (ERGIC)/Golgi complex and its incorporation into new virions. However, it is not required for the assembly process[ 48].
